direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly stops and looks up at the hospital but can't bring himself to go in. He pedals on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly sits on the loading dock of an abandoned factory. He watches the rusty barges glitter on the water. The wind ruffles his sweaty hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly's at the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She closes the door. Kelly wheels his bike down the driveway. He sees Bart sitting out by the pool with a couple of LANGELY BOYS. Bart sees Kelly and ignores him, laughs at something one of the guys says.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bart's not here. Sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kelly sits on the toilet, putting a bandage on a red scrape down his arm. Eve appears in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly looks up at her. He's still got the cut eyebrow, which has split back open, and some dried blood under his nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eve comes over and tilts Kelly's head back to look at the cut. This is the first time she's touched him. She gets some antiseptic and ointment from under the sink along with Band-Aids and goes to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly lets her dab at his face. He closes his eyes. EVE I'm going over to see dad. Kelly opens his eyes and pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eve puts a butterfly bandage across Kelly's eyebrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly pulls his head away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eve looks at Kelly sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eve shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eve rises to her feet. He's just sent her over the edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stops and breaks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eve looks at her son. Her face looks older.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eve leaves. Kelly sits on the toilet, lost.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh Kelly. What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus. Let me see that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you need to come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At this point that's not an option.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now's not a good time, ma.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's never a good time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't make me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice rising) It's not about you anymore -- KELLY Don't you get it? It was never about me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (yelling) What is wrong with you? When are you going to stop blaming us, blaming him? I'm sick of you being angry. I want to be angry! They just took out half of your father's stomach -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screaming and crying) You will not tell me what's enough. You don't know about anything. All you do is fight fake battles, in the woods, on the playground. But this, right here, us - this is the real one, the only one worth anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The man I love is dying.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's between you and him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I made a mistake, if you felt left out, I'm sorry. But I can only deal with one thing at a time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The sun shines in through Kelly's window. He's laying in bed awake - has been for a while. He gets up and starts dressing slowly and deliberately. He puts on his best shirt and tie, sensing trouble when the tie's too short. He pulls the suit out of his closet. The jacket doesn't fit. The sleeves don't even go down to his wrists. And he can hardly button the pants. He rips off the jacket. He pulls everything out of his closet. Nothing there. He sits on the edge of his bed with his head in his hands. He looks at his DRESS UNIFORM, hanging on the back of the closet in its dry-cleaning bag, right where his mom left it. He shakes his head. No, he couldn't do that. Then he sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's decorated for a wedding. Flower garlands trail up the banisters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: trickle in. Harrison, dressed in a suit with a boutonniere on his lapel, talks to an USHER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bart comes outside, also dressed as an usher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bart walks down the steps and looks down the street. Kelly's walking towards him. IN HIS DRESS UNIFORM. Bart walks down the street to meet him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly looks down. He can't meet Bart's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bart looks at Kelly and shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly finally looks up at Bart and nods. A Town Car pulls up. Tabby gets out in her wedding dress. Has there even been a more glorious woman? Will there ever be again? Her MAID OF HONOR leads her around to the side of the church. Kelly watches every step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly walks off. Bart watches him go.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't sit any of Mathilda's sisters next to me if you can help it. (to guest) Oh, hello. So nice to see you. Thank you for coming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Bart) Where's the priest?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He should be here any minute. Calm down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the fuck are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was invited.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I uninvited you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not your wedding.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why are you wearing that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softening) I can't let you come in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because you know why. Just go home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She looks beautiful. Tell her - give her my congratulations.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kelly sits on the edge of the bed, head in hands. He sees the torn rabbit painting. After a minute, he picks it up and looks at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Xiou-Xiou sits painting. Kelly enters with the rabbit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She examines it and takes out a wet sponge. She wipes it across the back of the canvas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She works silently for a minute. Kelly watches her. She cuts a small piece of canvas to repair the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns the painting over and gets out some paints to touch it up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh! Son of Eve. You startled me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Grandma Ling. Can you fix this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your mom made it for you. I can fix it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you come here to work on your own stuff? Don't waste your time on this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I never waste time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See. Everything can be mended.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're trying to tell me something, aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no. I could not tell you anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eve sleeps in a chair next to Abe, in bed sleeping. He looks pale but otherwise fine. Kelly stands in the doorway, still in his uniform. Abe comes to and sees him standing there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly comes into the room and sits in a chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abe and Kelly look up at the television in the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both continue to look up at the television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abe looks at Kelly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly nods. Eve wakes up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey. Kelly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey dad. How you feeling?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They gave me some stitches downstairs. (points to eyebrow) Three.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you get punched?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A couple times, actually.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know the feeling. Come on in and watch some television. Don't worry, this one's bolted to the wall. As you can see, my reputation precedes me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any battles this weekend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A few.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Busy, busy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Answer me this: how come no one ever reenacts the Vietnam War?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It'd be pretty depressing, wouldn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess it would.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Plus that, you'd have to have protesters and stuff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Folks dressed up like your mom and me. People reenacting fleeing to Canada, burning draft cards. I guess that would ruin the spirit of the thing, now wouldn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I could make it work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I bet you could.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kelly, is that you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were expecting some one else?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kelly and Eve get snacks from the vending machine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eve looks at Kelly, her face full of love and sadness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly nods slowly, taking this in. And it is finally too much. He breaks down and cries. For the fear and the misplaced rage, the fights and the stubbornness. But finally, relief. They walk back down the hall together. Eve reaches out and puts her hand on Kelly's neck.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He looks good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He looks just like you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kelly rides his bike past the house and stops when he sees the car packed up in front. Bart comes out with a box of stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bart puts the box in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stand there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly gives him a little ra-ra with one hand. Bart smiles. Kelly's been doing his research.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly lifts his foot up to the pedal of his bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bart laughs a little and shakes his head. Kelly is gone. Harrison comes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harrison checks the ties on the roof.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey. You going away already?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. The have this intensive summer orientation thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that good?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it's optional, but dad thinks it would be "a good way to meet people."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's probably right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He usually is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, go Big Green.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have fun. And get laid, will ya?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that everything?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everything you'd let me bring.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give me a break.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kelly stocks shelves. There's a NEW GIRL working the register. Kelly sees SARAH come in. He follows her to the bakery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah picks some bagels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly moves around to her other side, closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah moves away. Once bitten twice shy and all that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah walks to the front of the store. Kelly walks with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah turns to him at the checkout aisle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How come you don't work here anymore? The Electro-shopper's getting rusty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got a summer internship at an ad agency.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fancy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's all right, I guess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it's great.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When are you going to get a real job?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. Probably when I figure out something better to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't be a stock boy your whole life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah I can. I mean, I probably won't, but I could.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it was good seeing you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Um.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Remember that presentation I told you never to ask me about again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . OLD SOLDIERS' HOME - DAY Kelly stands in the front of the room, pointing to a battle plan with large arrows drawn on it. Charlie, Mr. Norman, Principal Holmstead, Eve and Sarah sit among other OLD SOLDIERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly keeps talking. Many of the OLD SOLDIERS sleep.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Lee arrayed his defenses over here. Only this time, Grant was ready for him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to old soldier 2) This is boring.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Let's see that slide of the wife again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sarah, Kelly, and Eve play dominos with Charlie and Mr. Norman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly tries to gesture to Sarah "no."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Norman smiles at the group.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . NORMAN (to Charlie) Remarkable, remarkable. And they never knew?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The real kicker was moving those cutouts of tanks around. The thought we had a whole regiment over there, but it was just a couple of us and those Hollywood props.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's amazing. Art playing a part in war.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're damned right. We practically won the thing right there. (eyeing Sarah and Eve with approval) Now this is more like it. Anyone care to place a wager on the table?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you think it would be more fun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . NORMAN I can't imagine having more fun that I am now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're never been to a French whorehouse, I take it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . NORMAN Oh, my.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . OLD SOLDIERS' HOME - DAY Eve waits while Kelly and Sarah walk out to Sarah's car. Kelly helps Sarah into it and closes the door for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pulls away. He watches her go.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I still don't understand how you did that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I spent my summers with my grandma in the Catskills. She didn't give me any spending money. (shrugs) So I played the bones for ice cream.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hot damn.
dialogue.name: dialogue
